properties.description: This is a sample workflow that hits an API server that returns a JSON response with a number of fake 'user' objects with their metadata, parses that response to extract 'names' of users, and sets a list of those 'names' in the workflow's output variable. After each step in the workflow, a logging block or 'breadcrumb' is placed that logs the status and transitively, the progress of preceeding activities in the workflow in a global table.
Target used to invoke iroh endpoints

column_data.log: Set Output Variable - Output populated? false

tabletype_01R6ONM68O92N42kFVHtGLcZnuEHE4.display_name: Logging Table Data Type With State

properties.name: Custom Log Message
properties.description: This is an optional parameter that will be suffixed to the log message

Breadcrumbs lets you add checkpoints to your workflows that you can then 'trace' in near real-time or retrospectively via external systems. This can be especially useful as a stack trace for error/exception handling. 

You may drop this atomic action strategically in multiple parts of your workflow and breadcrumbs will store all progress between two consecutive checkpoints in a table data type named "All My Breadcrumbs".

This workflow  is coupled with a sample workflow that can be externally triggered via SXO's REST API to read from the "All My Breadcrumbs" table & output the progress.

For more on usage guidance, please review the section on breadcrumbs on our Git repo here: https://github.com/ciscomanagedservices/sxo-utilities

properties.script:
import json
import sys
d = json.loads(f'''{sys.argv[1]}''')
existing = $activity.definition_activity_01LM5H3PE7I7Y6k3oOQO6UiENlLXl3Q1mDT.output.response_body$
new_existing = []
for action in existing:
    new_existing.append(action['activity_id'])
existing = new_existing
output_str = ''
def get_logs(l):
    # output_str = ''
    global output_str
    for action in l:
        if "Logging" not in action['title'] and action['status']['state'] != 'created'  and action['status']['state'] != 'running' and f'''{action['id']},{action['title']},{action['status']['state']};''' not in output_str and action['id'] not in existing:
            output_str += f'''{action['id']},{action['title']},{action['status']['state']};'''
    # return output_str
def get_activities(d):
    if d.get('actions'):
        actions = d['actions']
    elif d.get('blocks'):
        actions = d['blocks']
    logs = ''
    for action in actions:
        if action.get('blocks') or action.get('actions'):
            get_activities(action)
            # logs += get_activities(action)
        elif 'Logging' in action['name']:
            # logs += get_logs(actions)
            get_logs(actions)
    # return logs
# final_logs = get_activities(d)
get_activities(d)
final_logs = output_str
print(final_logs)
#if(int(sys.argv[2]) > 0 and sys.argv[3]  and sys.argv[3] != 'None' and sys.argv[3] != ''):
#    final_logs = final_logs.split(f'''{sys.argv[3]}''')[-1]
#    # print(final_logs.split(f'''{sys.argv[3]}'''))
#    final_logs = ';'.join(final_logs.split(';')[1:])
#print(final_logs)

properties.description:
WARNING: EXPERIMENTAL USE ONLY
SecureX Orchestrator (SXO) APIs are not generally available/exposed in production yet. However, if the AO API scope were to be added to a SecureX API Client, this workflow demonstrates how to use such an API Client to generate and retrieve a JWT token that can be used to make API calls to SXO, assuming the API methods are known to the user. The methodology used in this workflow may be subject to change once this functionality is available in production.

Steps involved:
1. Generate a new Access Token for Cisco Threat Response (CTR) using the SecureX API Client (with AO scope added) credentials defined in the Account Key for the CTR Admin target. This returns the SecureX Auth Token.
2. Use the SecureX Auth Token to make a call to CTRs AO endpoint to generate the JWT
3. Clean up response
4. Output a secure string with the SXO JWT

A given SXO JWT is valid only for ~10 minutes and needs to be regenerated thereafter using the same methodology.
